intro: Turraea laciniata, commonly known as the slit-leaved turraea, is a tropical shrub native to regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, deeply lobed leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody capsules that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation projects.
